Sabol. ''When Allen Iverson started wearing it, it was for a purpose- to keep elbow swelling down and protect it from further injury- and then he sparked a fad,'' Sabol said. From a sports medicine perspective, the sleeve does offer a little bit of compression, keeps the joint warm and can be fitted with a pad to protect the elbow from further injury when players dive on the floor. That's mainly why Dwyane Wade wears one, because of the physical nature of his game. But for many athletes, it's more that they like how it looks and feel good wearing it.
